de.ralleytn.simple.vecmath

Class Vector<T extends Vector<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ralleytn.simple.vecmath.Vector<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the vector type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Quaternion, Vector2, Vector3, Vector4, VectorN

    public abstract class Vector<T extends Vector<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    The abstract representation of a vector.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Ralph Niemitz/RalleYTN(ralph.niemitz@gmx.de)

      abstract T absolute()
      Sets all elements of this vector to their absolute value.
      T clamp(float min, float max)
      Clamps this vector to the the given range.

      Clamps this vector to the given maximum value.
      abstract T clampMin(float min)
      Clamps this vector to the given minimum value.
      abstract T copy()
      Creates a copy of this vector.
      float length()
      Calculates the actual length of this vector's hypotenuse.
      abstract float lengthSquared()
      Calculates the length of this vector according to Pythagoras (a² + b² = c²).
      abstract T negate()
      Negates the vector.
      T normalize()
      Normalizes the vector.
      abstract T scale(float scale)
      Scales the vector.

      Converts this vector to a float array.

        public Vector()

    • Method Detail

      • lengthSquared

        public abstract float lengthSquared()
        Calculates the length of this vector according to Pythagoras (a² + b² = c²). The result of this method is the squared length of the vector's hypotenuse.
        Returns:
        FOREACH element in elements DO lengthSquared = lengthSquared + element²
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • negate

        public abstract T negate()
        Negates the vector.

        this instance will be manipulated

        Returns:
        FOREACH element in elements DO element = -element
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • toArray

        public abstract float[] toArray()
        Converts this vector to a float array.
        Returns:
        this vector as a float array
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • scale

        public abstract T scale(float scale)
        Scales the vector.

        this instance will be manipulated

        Parameters:
        scale - the scalar value
        Returns:
        FOREACH element in elements DO element = element * scale
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • copy

        public abstract T copy()
        Creates a copy of this vector.
        Returns:
        a copy of this vector
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • absolute

        public abstract T absolute()
        Sets all elements of this vector to their absolute value. this instance will be manipulated

        Returns:
        FOREACH element in elements DO IF element < 0.0F THEN element = -element
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • clampMin

        public abstract T clampMin(float min)
        Clamps this vector to the given minimum value. this instance will be manipulated

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum value
        Returns:
        FOREACH element in elements DO IF element < min THEN element = min
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • clampMax

        public abstract T clampMax(float max)
        Clamps this vector to the given maximum value. this instance will be manipulated

        Parameters:
        max - the maximum value
        Returns:
        FOREACH element in elements DO IF element > max THEN element = max
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • clamp

        public final T clamp(float min,
                     float max)
        Clamps this vector to the the given range. this instance will be manipulated

        Parameters:
        min - the minimum value
        max - the maximum value
        Returns:
        clampMax(clampMin(a, min), max)
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • normalize

        public final T normalize()
        Normalizes the vector.

        this instance will be manipulated

        Returns:
        scale(1.0F / length())
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • length

        public final float length()
        Calculates the actual length of this vector's hypotenuse.
        Returns:
        sqrt(lengthSquared())
        Since:
        1.0.0
